_comment: Created by NCODowd on 27/04/2016 10:33:36 using v2.7
title: How have alcohol related deaths changed in different age and sex groups?
analysis_commentary: The alcohol-related death rate in women is half that of men: in 2014 it was 19.4 for men compared 9.6 for women per 100,000 population. Over the past 2 decades, rates of alcohol related deaths have increased by 59% in men and 52% in women. The alcohol related death rate is highest in middle age (45-70 years).
data_source: Office for National Statistics, Alcohol Related Deaths
